Text.Value: You are clearly novices, but I will serve as second for you both, if you wish.
We'll settle this another time, Gorran. Try not to spend the rest of your fortune by then.
Such actions demand retribution. It is only right you deliver it.
Sounds like a duel is the only answer.
I can't wait to see this.
Well, that's rather uncalled for. It was just a light spot of duelling.
I most certainly will not.
Attack them both.
Sounds like a duel is the only answer.
Leave.
Stop this, or I'm sticking both of your heads through that bloody painting.
See? You're not getting out of this.
Do not sacrifice your lives on such petty grounds. They are too precious.
Because - because - that's not the point! You sold me a fake, and you're going to pay for it. If not in gold, then in blood!
This can't be solved with words - only blades. Fight! WIN!
Yes, I suppose that's my only option, given I've clearly no hope of getting my gold back the right way.

EditorData.NodeContext: with verbal side-eye at his friend who won't pay him back

Text.Value: This ruffian wishes to harm us. I won't stand for it. Will you?
How dare you? You - you blaggard!

EditorData.NodeContext: Outraged at the player's calling him a gullible fool

Text.Value: Ridiculous - I'd know a fake from half a furlong away!
What are you duelling over?
And I want my painting back.

EditorData.NodeContext: Adding final clause to an annoying agreement - been forced to provide a refund

Text.Value: Oh good. An audience come to witness your stupidity.
Why not just sell the fake to another gullible fool?
The painting isn't a fake!

EditorData.NodeContext: Outraged that the player agreed with his opponent

Text.Value: You're both as stupid as each other. Duel away.
Then why did you buy it from me in the first place, you insufferable idiot?
It's settled then. Perhaps it's time I wrote to my cousin in Waterdeep...

EditorData.NodeContext: Acting casual, going to sell his cousin a fake painting

Text.Value: Gorran here can't tell a fake painting from a real one. And he'd rather die than admit it.
Sell it, burn it, have your servants tuck you in at night with it - I don't care, so long as I never hear about it again.
I... I suppose I'd rather not die over it. But you still owe me the gold.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slightly abashed, embarassed at how things escalated. Other NPC owes him the gold, not the player

Text.Value: Fine. I'll speak with my financier, see if she can transfer it to your vault. You'll have it by tomorrow.
Stop trying to distract me, and prepare yourself. We begin on my say!
We begin!
Attack them both.
No need, I'll finish this in one strike.

Synopsis: Two nobles are about to duel over the fact that one of them sold a fake painting to the other, for a very considerable amount of money. If the player interrupts, they can attempt to prevent the duel, attack the pair, or let it unfold.
